tip: Find the darkest location possible, away from city lights. Give your eyes 20 minutes to adjust to darkness

name: Catch Your First Fish
outcome: Land your first fish using proper casting technique and basic fishing knowledge

steps.label: Learn Rod and Reel Basics
steps.text: Understand spinning reel components: handle, bail, drag adjustment. Practice casting without water 10 times to build muscle memory

steps.label: Prepare Your Setup
steps.text: Tie an improved clinch knot to attach the hook. Set drag to slip when pulled hard. Load reel with line properly

steps.label: Find Good Fishing Spots
steps.text: Research local water. Look for structure: rocks, weeds, fallen trees. Fish early morning or late afternoon when fish are most active

steps.label: Master Your Casting
steps.text: Hold rod with dominant hand on grip, index finger on line. Open bail, accelerate to 10 o'clock, release line from finger smoothly

steps.label: Set the Hook and Reel In
steps.text: When you feel a bite, quickly raise rod tip (set the hook). Reel steadily while keeping tension on line. Land fish by guiding it to you

tip: Start with live bait for better success. Be patient; fishing requires waiting and observation

name: Forage Edible Wild Plants Safely
outcome: Ability to safely identify and harvest 10+ edible wild plants from your region

steps.label: Study Identification Thoroughly
steps.text: Get a regional foraging guide. Learn key characteristics: leaf shape, color, texture, growth patterns, smell. Know dangerous lookalikes

steps.label: Learn Safety Rules
steps.text: Never eat anything unless 100% certain. Use the rule of three: positive identification, edible part, proper preparation

steps.label: Start with Easy Plants
steps.text: Begin with unmistakable plants like dandelion, clover, chickweed. Learn seasonal availability. Photograph examples in your journal

steps.label: Practice Foraging Outdoors
steps.text: Go to a park or field with your guide. Find 5 different edible plants. Verify identification multiple times before harvesting

steps.label: Process and Use Your Harvest
steps.text: Clean plants thoroughly. Learn proper preparation: some need cooking, others eaten raw. Record your findings and recipes in a journal

tip: Forage in clean areas away from pesticides and roads. Take only what you need and leave some for the ecosystem

name: Speed Read 2x Faster
outcome: Read at 600+ words per minute while retaining 70%+ comprehension

steps.label: Eliminate Subvocalization
steps.text: Stop 'speaking' words mentally while reading. Use finger to guide eyes. This removes the biggest speed barrier

steps.label: Expand Eye Span
steps.text: Train eyes to take in 3-5 words per fixation instead of 1. Use margin marker or pointer to guide wider vision arc

steps.label: Increase Fixation Speed
steps.text: Use pointer to move down page faster, forcing eyes to follow. Start with 2x normal speed. Gradually increase pace

steps.label: Practice Chunking
steps.text: Pre-read headings and summaries. Recognize word patterns and phrases instead of reading word-by-word. Skim less critical sections

steps.label: Test Comprehension and Adjust
steps.text: Read passage at new speed, then answer questions. Adjust speed up or down based on material difficulty. Build consistency

tip: Speed reading works best for non-technical material. Slow down for complex concepts requiring deep comprehension

name: Build Any Habit in 90 Minutes of Planning
outcome: A crystallized action plan to build any habit with 90%+ success rate in the first 30 days

steps.label: Define Your Why
steps.text: Write why you want this habit. Connect it to your values and goals. Make it emotionally compelling, not just logical

steps.label: Chunk Down the Habit
steps.text: Break into smallest possible version. Instead of 'exercise daily,' start with '5 push-ups.' Make it stupid easy

steps.label: Create an Implementation Intention
steps.text: Write 'After [existing habit], I will [new habit].' Example: 'After pouring coffee, I will meditate 2 minutes.' Link to existing routine

steps.label: Plan Your Environment
steps.text: Remove friction: lay out workout clothes, prep breakfast, delete distracting apps. Make the habit easier than alternatives

steps.label: Commit and Track
steps.text: Write commitment statement. Create simple tracking system (calendar, app, checklist). Plan how you'll celebrate each win

tip: Start embarrassingly small. Consistency beats intensity. Celebrate completing the habit, not quality of execution

name: Memorize Anything with Memory Palace
outcome: Memorize lists of 50+ items, speeches, or sequences using the ancient memory palace technique

steps.label: Select Your Palace
steps.text: Choose a familiar location: your home, childhood house, or walking route. Visualize it vividly with 5-10 distinct rooms or stations

steps.label: Create Vivid Associations
steps.text: Link each item to memorize with a location in your palace using exaggeration, humor, or unusual imagery. The weirder, the better

steps.label: Create a Mental Journey
steps.text: Walk through your palace mentally, placing items in order. Use multiple senses: sight, sound, smell. Make connections memorable

steps.label: Practice Recall Drills
steps.text: Close your eyes. Walk through your palace mentally. Retrieve each item in order. Repeat multiple times until automatic

steps.label: Expand and Solidify
steps.text: Add more items to your palace. Create multiple palaces for different categories. Test yourself without looking at notes

tip: The more vivid and unusual the mental image, the better it sticks. Use multiple sensory details in your visualizations

name: Take Notes That Actually Help
outcome: A personal note-taking system that drives learning, retention, and actionable insights

steps.label: Choose a System
steps.text: Learn Cornell Notes, Zettelkasten, or Outline method. Pick one and commit. The best system is one you'll actually use

steps.label: Capture Active Concepts
steps.text: Don't transcribe. Listen for key ideas, definitions, and examples. Write in your own words to force understanding

steps.label: Mark and Organize
steps.text: Use symbols (*, !, ?), color-coding, or indentation. Create headers and subheaders. Leave white space for review additions

steps.label: Add Retrieval Cues
steps.text: Write questions on note margins or a separate page. Create summary statements. Link to previous notes. Build a personal knowledge web

steps.label: Review and Refine
steps.text: Review notes within 24 hours. Highlight or rewrite key points. Create a summary at the end. Identify gaps in understanding

tip: The act of handwriting notes boosts memory better than typing. Review notes often rather than taking endless new notes

name: Make Better Decisions with Mental Models
outcome: Make smarter decisions 80% of the time using 10+ proven mental models

steps.label: Learn Core Mental Models
steps.text: Study First-Principles Thinking, Opportunity Cost, Inversion, Circle of Competence. Understand their core principles and applications

steps.label: Practice First-Principles Thinking
steps.text: For a decision, break it to fundamental truths. Challenge assumptions. Ask 'Why?' five times. Build decisions from the ground up

steps.label: Apply Opportunity Cost Thinking
steps.text: What are you giving up by choosing option A? Explicitly consider what you're NOT doing. Often the clearest path becomes obvious

steps.label: Use Inversion and Checklist
steps.text: Work backwards: What would cause this to fail? Create a pre-mortem. Build decision checklists for recurring decisions

steps.label: Document and Review Decisions
steps.text: Write decisions made. Note the reasoning and model used. Review results 30 days later. Update your decision framework based on results

tip: Develop a decision journal. Track what you decided, why, and outcomes. This builds pattern recognition over time

name: Design Your Ideal Morning Routine
outcome: A personalized morning routine that energizes you and sets up your day for success

steps.label: Define Your Ideal Morning
steps.text: Imagine your perfect morning: wake time, energy level, mood, accomplishments. Write it down. What needs to happen?

steps.label: Identify Non-Negotiables
steps.text: List essentials: sleep, breakfast, hygiene, movement, focus. Rank by impact on your day. Keep list to 5-7 items maximum

steps.label: Build the Schedule
steps.text: Allocate time blocks: wake, hydrate, exercise, shower, breakfast, work prep. Create 30, 60, and 90-minute versions for flexibility

steps.label: Establish Evening Preparation
steps.text: Prepare the night before: clothes, breakfast items, schedule review. Remove morning decision-making. Lower friction

steps.label: Test and Iterate
steps.text: Execute your routine for 7 days. Track what works and what doesn't. Adjust activities and timing. Find your unique rhythm

tip: Start by moving your wake time 15 minutes earlier. Successful mornings compound over time to transform your life

name: Master Deep Focus
outcome: Consistently enter and maintain 4+ hour deep focus sessions with 90%+ quality output

steps.label: Understand Flow State
steps.text: Learn the conditions for deep focus: clear goal, immediate feedback, challenge-skill balance. Eliminate distractions ruthlessly

steps.label: Create Focus Environment
steps.text: Silence phone (or leave room). Close browser tabs. Use website blockers. Temperature at 68-72°F. Use white noise if needed

steps.label: Master the Pomodoro Method
steps.text: Work 25-50 minutes intensely, then 5-15 minute break. Track completed sessions. Gradually increase focus window to 90 minutes

steps.label: Build Ritual and Consistency
steps.text: Create pre-focus ritual: specific location, beverage, music. Work at same time daily. Your brain learns to drop into focus automatically

steps.label: Track and Optimize
steps.text: Log focus sessions, depth level, and output quality. Identify patterns. Adjust timing, environment, and tasks. Measure improvement

tip: The first 15 minutes are hardest. Push through resistance. Once flowing, you won't want to stop

name: Master Sleep Quality and Consistency
outcome: Consistent 7-9 hour nights of quality sleep with improved daytime energy and focus

steps.label: Establish Sleep Schedule
steps.text: Set consistent bedtime and wake time, even weekends. Your body's circadian rhythm responds to consistency, not duration alone

steps.label: Create Sleep Environment
steps.text: Cool room (65-68°F), complete darkness, minimal noise. Use blackout curtains, white noise machine. Remove blue light sources

steps.label: Build Evening Wind-Down
steps.text: 30 minutes before bed: dim lights, no screens. Try journaling, reading, stretching, or meditation. This signals sleep time to your brain

steps.label: Optimize Daytime Habits
steps.text: Get morning sunlight exposure. Avoid caffeine after 2 PM. Exercise daily but not right before bed. Manage stress throughout day

steps.label: Track and Troubleshoot
steps.text: Log sleep times, quality ratings, and daytime energy. Identify patterns. Adjust one variable at a time. Give changes 1-2 weeks

tip: Consistency matters more than total hours. A regular 7-hour sleep beats irregular 9-hour sleep

name: Unlock Your Creativity Daily
outcome: Generate 30+ unique ideas daily and develop a consistent creative practice

steps.label: Understand Creative Blocks
steps.text: Learn that creativity is a skill, not a gift. Identify your blocks: perfectionism, fear, self-criticism. Reframe as normal

steps.label: Practice Brainstorming Without Judgment
steps.text: Write 20 ideas without evaluating them. Quantity over quality. No idea is bad. Keep pen moving for full 20 minutes

steps.label: Try Ideation Techniques
steps.text: Learn SCAMPER, mind mapping, reverse brainstorming. Apply techniques to specific challenges. Generate diverse idea types

steps.label: Create and Share Work
steps.text: Create something: write, draw, build, design. Finish rough drafts rather than perfecting one idea. Share your work with others

steps.label: Reflect and Build Momentum
steps.text: Review your ideas. Identify patterns. Improve your favorite ideas. Commit to daily creative practice. Build a body of work

tip: Set a daily time for creativity, treat it as non-negotiable. Inspiration follows action, not the reverse

name: Manage Stress Effectively
outcome: A personal stress management toolkit with 5+ techniques you can deploy anywhere

steps.label: Recognize Stress Signals
steps.text: Learn your physical stress signs: tight shoulders, shallow breathing, racing thoughts. Identify triggers: time pressure, uncertainty

steps.label: Master Box Breathing
steps.text: Inhale 4 counts, hold 4, exhale 4, hold 4. Repeat 5 times. This activates parasympathetic nervous system, reducing stress immediately

steps.label: Practice Grounding Techniques
steps.text: 5-4-3-2-1 method: name 5 things you see, 4 hear, 3 touch, 2 smell, 1 taste. Brings mind to present, calms anxiety

steps.label: Build Prevention Habits
steps.text: Exercise regularly, sleep 7-9 hours, eat well, limit caffeine. These reduce baseline stress. Practice meditation 10 minutes daily

steps.label: Create Your Action Plan
steps.text: Write your stress toolkit: 3 immediate techniques, 3 daily practices, 3 weekly habits. Practice until automatic

tip: Prevention through sleep, exercise, and meditation is more effective than stress management alone

name: Learn 5 Card Magic Tricks
outcome: Perform 5 impressive card tricks that amaze audiences of any age

steps.label: Master Card Control
steps.text: Learn to shuffle, cut, and control card positions. Practice the overhand shuffle and false shuffle. Your hand position matters

steps.label: Learn the Classic Force
steps.text: Master making a spectator pick a 'forced' card of your choice. Practice 20 times. This is the foundation of many tricks

steps.label: Perform the Self-Working Tricks
steps.text: Learn the 21-card trick (principle-based), Double Prediction, and 4-card reveal. These require math, not sleight of hand

steps.label: Add Sleight of Hand
steps.text: Master the double lift (showing two cards as one) and false cut. Practice in front of mirror. Smoothness is key

steps.label: Practice Misdirection and Presentation
steps.text: Perform all 5 tricks for a friend. Work on patter (talking), timing, and misdirection. Build confidence through repetition

tip: Misdirection and presentation matter more than sleight. Tell a story around your tricks

name: Play Chess and Not Lose Immediately
outcome: Play respectable games of chess using solid opening principles and tactical awareness

steps.label: Learn Piece Values and Movement
steps.text: Master each piece: pawn (1), knight (3), bishop (3), rook (5), queen (9), king (infinite). Understand how each moves and captures

steps.label: Study Opening Principles
steps.text: Control center (e4 and d4), develop pieces (knights before bishops), castle early, avoid early queen, don't expose king

steps.label: Learn Basic Tactics
steps.text: Study forks, pins, skewers, discovered attacks. These win material. Practice spotting tactics 10 minutes daily on Chess.com

steps.label: Play Against Computer
steps.text: Start on easy level. Play 5 full games. Focus on applying principles, not winning. Analyze losses to understand mistakes

steps.label: Play Against Humans and Learn
steps.text: Play friends or online opponents. Play slowly (5+ minute games initially). Review games. Identify patterns in your play

tip: Focus on solid principles over memorizing openings. Tactical awareness (spotting threats) is more valuable than theory

name: Solve a Rubik's Cube
outcome: Solve a Rubik's cube in under 2 minutes using the beginner's layer-by-layer method

steps.label: Learn Cube Notation
steps.text: Understand U (up), D (down), L (left), R (right), F (front), B (back), and prime (opposite direction). Master turn notations

steps.label: Solve the White Cross
steps.text: Get white center on bottom. Create cross matching colors. This layer's foundation determines success for whole cube

steps.label: Complete the First Layer
steps.text: Place white corner pieces. Use the right-hand algorithm R U R' U' repeatedly if needed. All white pieces match side colors

steps.label: Solve the Middle Layer
steps.text: Place edge pieces without moving white cross. Master moving pieces side-to-side using specific algorithms. No guessing

steps.label: Solve the Yellow Cross and Top
steps.text: Create yellow cross on top (might not match), then permute and orient top layer pieces. Use algorithms until cube is solved

tip: The Rubik's cube is a puzzle of algorithms, not luck. Memorize 2-3 core algorithms and apply strategically

name: Learn to Juggle 3 Balls
outcome: Confidently juggle 3 balls in a continuous pattern without dropping

steps.label: Understand the Pattern
steps.text: Learn the basic cascade: balls cross in an X pattern. Left hand throws, right hand throws, left throws. Peak at eye level

steps.label: Practice One-Ball Toss
steps.text: Toss one ball from left hand to right hand at eye level. Catch easily. Do 50 times. Perfect the arch and consistency

steps.label: Add Second Ball
steps.text: Hold 2 balls in left hand, 1 in right. Toss left ball first. When at peak, throw right ball underneath. Catch. Repeat 20 times

steps.label: Add Third Ball and Complete Pattern
steps.text: Hold 2 left, 1 right. Toss left ball. At peak, toss right ball. At its peak, toss left ball again. Catch. Continue pattern

steps.label: Build Consistency and Speed
steps.text: Practice continuously without stopping. Build from 10-catch record to 50, then 100. Gradually increase speed. Make it automatic

tip: Focus on consistent throw height and timing, not catching. Throws determine ease of catches

name: Win at Poker Night
outcome: Win consistently at casual poker using solid strategy and bankroll management

steps.label: Understand Hand Rankings
steps.text: Royal Flush, Straight Flush, Four of a Kind, Full House, Flush, Straight, Three of a Kind, Two Pair, Pair, High Card. Memorize order

steps.label: Learn Position and Starting Hands
steps.text: Understand table positions: early, middle, late. Play tighter hands early, looser late. Know which hands win from each position

steps.label: Master Pot Odds and Betting
steps.text: Calculate pot odds: is potential win worth the cost? Bet and raise with strength, check/call with weakness. Don't limp

steps.label: Read Your Opponents
steps.text: Watch for tells: betting patterns, speed, hesitation. Notice who plays tight, loose, aggressive, passive. Adjust strategy accordingly

steps.label: Practice Game Theory
steps.text: Play multiple games. Track wins and losses. Review big hands. Understand expected value. Play with profit goal, not gamble mindset

tip: Fold more often. Average players lose because they play too many hands. Patience and position are fundamental

name: Master 5 Pool Shots
outcome: Execute 5 essential pool shots with consistency and control

steps.label: Perfect Your Stance
steps.text: Stand 45 degrees to shot line. Bridge hand firm but relaxed. Shooting arm pendulum motion. Aim through cue ball toward object ball

steps.label: Master the Straight Shot
steps.text: Line up directly behind cue ball. Hit center of cue ball. Follow through smoothly. Practice 20 shots in a row until consistent

steps.label: Learn the Angle Shot
steps.text: Hit object ball slightly off-center to sink it at an angle. Aim for the contact point, not the pocket. Practice right and left angles

steps.label: Practice the Bank Shot
steps.text: Bounce cue ball off rail before hitting object ball. Calculate angles using rail geometry. This shot impresses spectators

steps.label: Master Draw, Follow, and English
steps.text: Draw shot: hit below center, cue ball stops after contact. Follow shot: hit above center, cue ball moves forward. English: spin for angles

tip: Smooth, controlled strokes are better than power. Aim for precise contact, not luck

name: Master Darts: Score & Strategy
outcome: Throw accurately to double-digit scores and understand dart game strategy

steps.label: Learn the Dartboard Layout
steps.text: Memorize double ring, triple ring, outer bull, inner bull (50), and single scoring areas. Understand that 20 is highest single

steps.label: Master Your Grip and Stance
steps.text: Grip dart near back (like pencil). Feet shoulder-width apart. Arm at 90 degrees. Smooth release from fingertips. Practice stance

steps.label: Practice Accuracy and Consistency
steps.text: Throw 30 darts at single 20 repeatedly. Then practice treble 20 (60 points). Focus on grouping three darts together

steps.label: Learn Game Strategy (501)
steps.text: Standard game: score from 501 to zero with double-out. High-score round focuses on treble 20. End game requires doubles

steps.label: Play Full Games and Compete
steps.text: Play 501 against friends or computer. Track your three-dart average. Practice closing out games. Build match experience

tip: Consistency beats raw power. Focus on grouping darts, not maximum single throws

name: Write Your First Python Script
outcome: A working Python program that solves a real problem

steps.label: Set Up Your Environment
steps.text: Install Python 3 and choose a text editor like VS Code. Verify installation by running 'python --version' in terminal.

steps.label: Learn Python Basics
steps.text: Understand variables, data types, and basic operations. Write a simple program that stores your name and age, then prints them.

steps.label: Build a Calculator
steps.text: Create a program that takes two numbers as input and performs addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division.

steps.label: Add Decision Logic
steps.text: Use if/else statements to make your calculator choose operations. Handle edge cases like division by zero.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Run your calculator, test it with different inputs, and share the code. Next: explore loops and functions.

tip: Start small and test frequently. Print output at each step to see what's happening.

name: Build Your First Webpage
outcome: A live webpage about your interests visible in a browser

steps.label: Understand HTML Structure
steps.text: Learn that HTML is markup. Create a file called index.html with basic tags: html, head, body, h1, p.

steps.label: Write Your Content
steps.text: Add a heading, a few paragraphs, and a list to your page. Make it about something you love.

steps.label: Style with CSS
steps.text: Create a style.css file. Change colors, fonts, and spacing. Link it to your HTML using a link tag.

steps.label: Add Interactivity
steps.text: Include a button or link that does something simple using HTML and CSS hover effects.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Open index.html in your browser, share the file, and celebrate. Next: learn JavaScript.

tip: Use browser DevTools (F12) to inspect and test your CSS in real-time.

name: Master Excel Formulas
outcome: An automated spreadsheet that calculates and analyzes data without manual work

steps.label: Learn Formula Syntax
steps.text: Understand that formulas start with =. Practice simple math: =SUM(A1:A5), =AVERAGE(B1:B10).

steps.label: Create a Budget Sheet
steps.text: Build a spreadsheet with income and expenses. Use SUM to total each category.

steps.label: Use IF Statements
steps.text: Add a column that flags expenses over $100 using =IF(B2>100,"High","Low").

steps.label: Apply VLOOKUP
steps.text: Create a lookup table and use VLOOKUP to find values. Practice with product names and prices.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Format your sheet nicely and share it. Next: explore pivot tables and charts.

tip: Use named ranges to make formulas easier to read. Test edge cases.

name: Automate Your Daily Tasks with Zapier
outcome: Three automated workflows that save you hours each week

steps.label: Understand Triggers & Actions
steps.text: Learn that Zapier connects apps. A trigger (when X happens) starts an action (do Y).

steps.label: Build Your First Zap
steps.text: Create a zap that sends you an email reminder every Monday morning.

steps.label: Connect to Your Calendar
steps.text: Set up a zap that adds new emails tagged 'Event' to your Google Calendar.

steps.label: Save Data Automatically
steps.text: Create a zap that adds new Slack messages to a Google Sheet for record-keeping.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Turn on your zaps and watch them work. Next: explore Zapier's advanced filters.

tip: Start with apps you already use daily. Test each zap with a test action before activating.

name: Create Your First AI Chatbot
outcome: A working chatbot that answers questions about a topic you choose

steps.label: Explore ChatGPT
steps.text: Sign up for ChatGPT or access OpenAI's API. Understand how to write effective prompts.

steps.label: Design Your Chatbot
steps.text: Decide what your chatbot does. Example: answers questions about a book or product.

steps.label: Create a System Prompt
steps.text: Write instructions that tell the AI its role, tone, and boundaries. Test with sample questions.

steps.label: Build an Interface
steps.text: Use a no-code tool like Replit or create a simple HTML form to chat with your AI.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Test your chatbot, refine prompts, and share with friends. Next: add memory and personalities.

tip: Be specific in your prompts. Vague instructions lead to vague responses. Iterate and refine.

name: Design a Logo in Figma
outcome: A professional-looking logo suitable for personal brand or small business

steps.label: Navigate Figma
steps.text: Create a new project, understand the canvas, tools, and layers panel.

steps.label: Sketch Your Concept
steps.text: Use shapes (circles, rectangles, lines) to create a simple geometric logo design.

steps.label: Refine & Color
steps.text: Adjust shapes, align elements, and apply a cohesive color scheme.

steps.label: Add Typography
steps.text: Insert your business name or initials. Choose and size a font that matches the design.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Export as PNG and SVG. Share for feedback. Next: animate your logo.

tip: Keep it simple. The best logos work at any size. Reference great logos for inspiration.

name: Master Terminal Basics
outcome: Comfortable navigating and managing files entirely through the command line

steps.label: Open & Explore
steps.text: Open Terminal (Mac) or PowerShell (Windows). Type 'pwd' to see your location.

steps.label: Navigate Directories
steps.text: Use 'ls' to list files, 'cd' to change folders, and 'mkdir' to create new directories.

steps.label: Manage Files
steps.text: Practice 'cp' (copy), 'mv' (move), and 'rm' (delete) commands with test files.

steps.label: View & Edit Files
steps.text: Use 'cat' to view files, 'grep' to search, and 'nano' to edit text files.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Complete a project using only terminal. Next: learn about permissions and piping.

tip: Use 'man' command to read help for any command. Mistakes are hard to undo, so double-check before deleting.

name: Query a Database with SQL
outcome: Ability to extract, filter, and analyze data from a real database

steps.label: Understand Tables & Rows
steps.text: Learn that databases store data in tables with columns and rows. Explore a sample database.

steps.label: Write SELECT Queries
steps.text: Use SELECT * FROM table_name to retrieve all data. Filter with WHERE clauses.

steps.label: Join Tables
steps.text: Connect two tables using INNER JOIN to find related data.

steps.label: Aggregate & Group
steps.text: Use COUNT, SUM, AVG with GROUP BY to analyze patterns in your data.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Write 5 complex queries and save them. Next: learn INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE.

tip: Write queries step by step. Start simple and add complexity. Use comments to document your logic.

name: Secure Your Passwords with Encryption
outcome: A secure system for storing and managing your passwords safely

steps.label: Understand Password Security
steps.text: Learn why strong, unique passwords matter. Understand encryption basics.

steps.label: Choose a Password Manager
steps.text: Install a password manager like Bitwarden (free) or 1Password. Set a master password.

steps.label: Generate Strong Passwords
steps.text: Use your password manager to generate 12+ character passwords with mixed characters.

steps.label: Migrate Your Passwords
steps.text: Update 10 important accounts with new strong passwords stored in your manager.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Enable two-factor authentication on key accounts. Next: audit your security practices.

tip: Never reuse passwords. Use a password manager to remember them for you. Enable 2FA everywhere possible.

name: Analyze Data with Python Pandas
outcome: Insights extracted from a dataset with visualizations and statistical analysis

steps.label: Install & Import Pandas
steps.text: Install pandas using pip. Import it in Jupyter and understand DataFrames.

steps.label: Load & Explore Data
steps.text: Load a CSV file with pandas. Use head(), info(), describe() to understand your data.

steps.label: Clean Your Data
steps.text: Remove null values, handle duplicates, and standardize data formats.

steps.label: Analyze & Visualize
steps.text: Calculate statistics, group data, and create charts using matplotlib or seaborn.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Write conclusions from your analysis. Share your notebook. Next: explore machine learning.

tip: Start with small datasets. Understand your data before jumping to analysis. Document assumptions.

name: Add Interactivity with JavaScript
outcome: A webpage with buttons, forms, and interactive elements that respond to user actions

steps.label: Understand DOM
steps.text: Learn that JavaScript manipulates the Document Object Model. Practice selecting elements.

steps.label: Handle Events
steps.text: Add click listeners to buttons. Make elements change color or text on click.

steps.label: Build a Form
steps.text: Create a form that validates input and shows errors if data is invalid.

steps.label: Use Local Storage
steps.text: Save user data to browser storage so it persists after page reload.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Deploy your interactive page. Test across browsers. Next: learn frameworks like React.

tip: Use console.log() to debug. Learn DevTools well. Build incrementally and test often.

name: Build a Responsive Mobile-First Website
outcome: A website that looks perfect on phones, tablets, and desktops

steps.label: Understand Media Queries
steps.text: Learn CSS media queries to apply different styles based on screen size.

steps.label: Design Mobile First
steps.text: Start with a mobile layout, then add styles for tablet and desktop screens.

steps.label: Create Flexible Grids
steps.text: Use CSS Flexbox and Grid to build layouts that adapt to different widths.

steps.label: Optimize Images
steps.text: Use responsive images with srcset and picture elements. Ensure fast loading.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Test on real devices. Check mobile performance. Next: add PWA capabilities.

tip: Test on actual phones, not just browser emulators. Use DevTools device toolbar extensively.

name: Create Pivot Tables for Data Summary
outcome: Automated data summaries and insights from large datasets without writing formulas

steps.label: Prepare Your Data
steps.text: Ensure data has headers and no blank rows. Clean any inconsistencies.

steps.label: Insert a Pivot Table
steps.text: Select your data and use Insert > Pivot Table. Learn the pivot table dialog.

steps.label: Configure Rows & Columns
steps.text: Drag fields to rows, columns, and values. Group data by categories like month or region.

steps.label: Add Calculations
steps.text: Summarize values using SUM, AVG, COUNT. Apply filters to focus on subsets.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Create a chart from your pivot table. Present insights. Next: automate with formulas.

tip: Start simple with 2–3 fields. Refresh pivot tables when source data changes.

name: Build Webhooks with IFTTT
outcome: Custom automated workflows triggered by events from any app or service

steps.label: Understand Webhooks
steps.text: Learn how webhooks send data when events occur. Explore IFTTT platform.

steps.label: Create Basic Applets
steps.text: Build 2–3 simple applets connecting common apps like Gmail, Twitter, and Slack.

steps.label: Set Up Webhooks
steps.text: Learn to use Webhooks service. Send custom data to IFTTT from your own apps.

steps.label: Create Complex Workflows
steps.text: Chain multiple actions together. Add conditional logic where possible.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Activate all workflows and monitor them. Next: explore Make (formerly Integromat).

tip: Test each applet individually before chaining. Use filters to prevent unintended triggers.

name: Fine-Tune an AI Model for Your Domain
outcome: An AI model customized for your specific business or interest domain

steps.label: Gather Training Data
steps.text: Collect 50+ examples of text relevant to your domain in JSONL format.

steps.label: Prepare Your Data
steps.text: Format data correctly. Test with OpenAI's CLI tool. Validate against schema.

steps.label: Start Fine-Tuning Job
steps.text: Use OpenAI API to submit your data for fine-tuning. Monitor job progress.

steps.label: Test Your Model
steps.text: Query your fine-tuned model with test prompts. Compare to base model.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Deploy your model in production. Gather user feedback. Next: iterate and improve.

tip: Quality training data is everything. More examples = better results. Iterate based on test results.

name: Build an Interactive Prototype in Figma
outcome: A clickable prototype that simulates your app or website interaction flow

steps.label: Design Multiple Screens
steps.text: Create wireframes or designs for 3–5 key pages of your app/website.

steps.label: Learn Figma Interactions
steps.text: Understand prototype links and interactions. Connect buttons to different screens.

steps.label: Build User Flow
steps.text: Create interaction chains that mimic real user journeys. Add transitions.

steps.label: Test & Refine
steps.text: Use Figma's play mode to test your prototype. Adjust flows based on feedback.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Share prototype link with stakeholders. Gather feedback. Next: add animations.

tip: Prototype only key flows, not everything. Use consistent naming for frames.

name: Write Shell Scripts for Automation
outcome: Executable scripts that automate repetitive tasks and save hours per month

steps.label: Learn Shell Syntax
steps.text: Understand variables, loops, and conditionals in bash. Write a simple script.

steps.label: Create Backup Script
steps.text: Write a script that copies important folders to a backup location with timestamps.

steps.label: Add Error Handling
steps.text: Use if statements and error codes to make scripts robust.

steps.label: Build File Processing
steps.text: Create a script that processes multiple files (rename, convert, move).

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Schedule scripts with cron. Document and test. Next: explore more advanced scripting.

tip: Start simple. Test scripts thoroughly before automating critical tasks. Use version control.

name: Design a Relational Database
outcome: A properly structured database for a real application or business problem

steps.label: Understand Normalization
steps.text: Learn about database normalization rules (1NF, 2NF, 3NF) to avoid data redundancy.

steps.label: Define Entities
steps.text: Identify tables and columns for your application. List all attributes needed.

steps.label: Create ER Diagram
steps.text: Draw entity relationships using a tool. Show primary and foreign keys.

steps.label: Implement Database
steps.text: Write CREATE TABLE statements. Set up constraints and indexes.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Insert sample data. Test relationships. Next: optimize with indexes.

tip: Think about queries before designing. Avoid unnecessary joins. Use meaningful names.

name: Conduct a Network Security Audit
outcome: A comprehensive security report identifying vulnerabilities and improvement areas

steps.label: Identify Assets
steps.text: List all devices, software, and services on your network that need protection.

steps.label: Assess Vulnerabilities
steps.text: Use scanning tools to identify open ports, outdated software, and weak configurations.

steps.label: Check Access Controls
steps.text: Review user permissions, firewall rules, and password policies.

steps.label: Review Policies
steps.text: Evaluate backup procedures, update schedules, and incident response plans.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Write findings report with recommendations. Prioritize fixes. Next: implement solutions.

tip: Document everything. Get permission before scanning. Prioritize by risk level.

name: Build Predictive Models with Regression
outcome: A working predictive model that forecasts outcomes based on historical data

steps.label: Understand Regression
steps.text: Learn linear and logistic regression concepts. Explore when to use each.

steps.label: Prepare Training Data
steps.text: Load data, handle missing values, and split into training and test sets.

steps.label: Train Your Model
steps.text: Fit a regression model using scikit-learn. Evaluate accuracy metrics.

steps.label: Visualize Results
steps.text: Create plots showing predictions vs. actual values. Identify patterns.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Make predictions on new data. Document your model. Next: explore classification.

tip: Feature selection matters. Avoid overfitting. Always validate on separate test data.

name: Build a React Component Library
outcome: A reusable library of UI components for your projects and team

steps.label: Plan Components
steps.text: Define 5–10 core components (Button, Card, Modal, etc.) and their props.

steps.label: Set Up Project
steps.text: Use Create React App or Vite. Set up TypeScript and Storybook.

steps.label: Build Components
steps.text: Create reusable components with consistent API and styling.

steps.label: Document & Test
steps.text: Write Storybook stories. Add unit tests with Jest. Document API.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Publish to npm. Gather feedback. Next: add advanced patterns and animations.

tip: Think about accessibility and responsiveness from the start. Use semantic HTML.

name: Design Microservices Architecture
outcome: A scalable microservices architecture for a distributed application

steps.label: Learn Microservices
steps.text: Understand benefits and challenges. Compare to monolithic architecture.

steps.label: Define Services
steps.text: Break down application into independent, loosely-coupled services.

steps.label: Design APIs
steps.text: Define REST or gRPC APIs for service-to-service communication.

steps.label: Containerize & Orchestrate
steps.text: Create Docker containers for each service. Set up Kubernetes deployment.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Deploy to cloud platform. Monitor and scale. Next: add service mesh.

tip: Start with a single microservice. Don't over-engineer. Understand trade-offs.

name: Master Power Query for ETL
outcome: Automated data pipelines that extract, transform, and load data from multiple sources

steps.label: Explore Power Query
steps.text: Open Power Query editor. Understand M language basics.

steps.label: Extract Data
steps.text: Connect to multiple sources (CSV, SQL, APIs). Import data.

steps.label: Transform Data
steps.text: Clean, filter, merge, and pivot data using Power Query transformations.

steps.label: Write Custom M Code
steps.text: Create functions and complex transformations using M language.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Automate refresh cycles. Build dashboard. Next: integrate with Power BI.

tip: Test transformations step-by-step. Keep queries modular and reusable.

name: Create Advanced Multi-Step IFTTT Workflows
outcome: Complex business automations that integrate 10+ services and handle edge cases

steps.label: Plan Workflow
steps.text: Map out a complex business process. Identify all data transformations needed.

steps.label: Build Applet Chain
steps.text: Create 5+ interconnected applets. Use webhooks to pass data between them.

steps.label: Handle Errors
steps.text: Implement error handling, retries, and notifications for failures.

steps.label: Add Custom Logic
steps.text: Use webhooks to implement conditional logic not available in standard applets.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Test all scenarios. Monitor execution. Next: evaluate alternative tools.

tip: Document every step. Test failure scenarios. Keep logs of all executions.

name: Develop Production LLM Applications
outcome: A production-grade application using LLMs with proper error handling and monitoring

steps.label: Understand LLM Frameworks
steps.text: Explore LangChain, LlamaIndex. Learn about chains and agents.

steps.label: Build RAG System
steps.text: Implement Retrieval Augmented Generation using vector embeddings.

steps.label: Create Agents
steps.text: Build multi-step agents that can use tools and make decisions.

steps.label: Implement Safety
steps.text: Add input validation, rate limiting, and output filtering.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Deploy application. Monitor costs and usage. Next: implement fine-tuning.

tip: Test extensively for edge cases and harmful outputs. Monitor token usage closely.

name: Master Advanced Figma Animations & Prototypes
outcome: Complex animated prototypes with smooth transitions and interactive states

steps.label: Learn Animation Principles
steps.text: Study easing, timing, and appeal in motion design.

steps.label: Create Smooth Transitions
steps.text: Build prototypes with custom easing and timing functions.

steps.label: Implement State Machine
steps.text: Create complex interactive components with multiple states and behaviors.

steps.label: Polish Details
steps.text: Add micro-interactions, loading states, and error animations.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Export prototype. Share with developers. Next: explore Framer.

tip: Animation should enhance UX, not distract. Test on different devices and speeds.

name: Build a Complete DevOps CI/CD Pipeline
outcome: Automated deployment pipeline from code commit to production with zero downtime

steps.label: Understand CI/CD
steps.text: Learn concepts of continuous integration and deployment.

steps.label: Set Up Version Control
steps.text: Configure GitHub workflow. Set up branch protection and code review.

steps.label: Build Pipeline
steps.text: Create GitHub Actions or GitLab CI workflow. Add testing and building steps.

steps.label: Deploy to Production
steps.text: Set up automated deployment to cloud. Add health checks and rollback.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Monitor deployment. Add logging and alerting. Next: implement canary deployments.

tip: Test extensively before production. Keep deployment scripts simple and idempotent.

name: Optimize Complex SQL Queries
outcome: Dramatically faster query execution and reduced database load

steps.label: Profile Queries
steps.text: Use EXPLAIN PLAN to understand query execution. Identify slow queries.

steps.label: Create Strategic Indexes
steps.text: Build indexes on frequently searched columns and joins.

steps.label: Rewrite Complex Queries
steps.text: Optimize joins, subqueries, and aggregations. Use window functions.

steps.label: Implement Caching
steps.text: Cache frequent queries. Use materialized views for complex aggregations.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Monitor improvements. Document optimizations. Next: explore partitioning.

tip: Measure before and after. Small improvements at scale matter. Don't over-index.

name: Conduct Ethical Penetration Testing
outcome: A comprehensive penetration test report identifying security weaknesses

steps.label: Understand Methodology
steps.text: Learn OWASP testing methodology. Understand legal and ethical constraints.

steps.label: Reconnaissance
steps.text: Gather information about target. Use passive and active techniques.

steps.label: Find Vulnerabilities
steps.text: Test for common exploits (SQL injection, XSS, CSRF). Use automated tools.

steps.label: Exploit Findings
steps.text: Prove vulnerabilities with careful, controlled testing.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Write detailed report with recommendations. Present findings ethically.

tip: Always get written permission. Stay within scope. Document everything carefully.

name: Build End-to-End Machine Learning Pipeline
outcome: A production ML system that automatically trains, evaluates, and deploys models

steps.label: Define Problem
steps.text: Clearly define business problem, success metrics, and model requirements.

steps.label: Prepare Data
steps.text: Clean, normalize, and split data. Create feature engineering pipeline.

steps.label: Train & Evaluate
steps.text: Experiment with models. Track experiments using MLflow. Compare results.

steps.label: Automate Pipeline
steps.text: Create automated workflow using Airflow or similar. Orchestrate from data to predictions.

steps.label: Ship & next steps
steps.text: Deploy model. Set up monitoring. Next: implement A/B testing.

tip: Focus on data quality. Document assumptions. Monitor model drift in production.
